subject: Design
title: Sensible Defaults: Doing the Thinking for Users
description: A short lesson to help you apply Sensible Defaults: Doing the Thinking for Users.

hook.text: Only 12% of people change default settings. The other 88% trust whatever the designer chose.

buildup.text: Defaults are the most powerful design tool because most users never override them.

discovery.text: Countries with opt-out organ donation have 90%+ donor rates. Opt-in countries average 15%.

twist.text: This means designers â€” not users â€” are making most of the decisions through default choices.

climax.text: Sensible defaults reduce cognitive load and respect users' time. Bad defaults exploit their inertia.

punchline.text: The default is the real decision. Everything else is optional.

quiz.question: Why are defaults so powerful in UX design?
